result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon Arthur Jackson

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jon Arthur Jackson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF424, 21CM296, and 22CF33. Court notes that victims may be appearing. Victim 1 in 21CF424 is on Zoom. Parties note an agreement. Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 21CF424. Sentence on Count 1 will be withheld for 30 months of probation. Conditions of 70 days jail with credit for 2 day, DOC programming, and $50 fine plus costs. Count 2 will be dismissed. Defendant will plead to sole count in 21CM296. Sentence of 6 days jail with credit for 5 (time served) and $50 fine plus costs. 22CF33 will be dismissed but read in. State is in compliance with Victim Rights. State notes Victim Impact Statements have been filed in 21CF424. Attorney Rosenthal is in agreement, asks for huber to be granted for work. Asks for report date in about 30 days at 6:00 PM. State has no objection.
Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 in 21CF424 and Count 1 in 21CM296. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas. Court finds the pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Judgment of Conviction is entered. Count 2 in 21CF424 is dismissed. 22CF33 is dismissed but read in. No victims would like to give statement. 
State makes statement, notes only previous traffic convictions. State reviews the charges in the cases and notes social media post showing lack of remorse. Court reviews victim impact statements. Attorney Rosenthal makes statements, notes defendant's remorse and has done DAIP training. Is a productive and contributing member of society. Notes lack of record. Asks court to adopt recommendation. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statements. 
Court orders on Count 1 in 21CF424, withheld sentence for 30 months of probation. Conditions of 70 days jail with credit for 2 days, DOC programming, and $50 fine plus costs. Huber granted for work. Report date is November 8 at 6:00 PM. 
Court orders in 21CM296, sentence of 6 days jail with credit for 5 (time served) and $50 fine plus costs. Bail on all 3 files is applied to fines and costs.

9:31 AM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jon Arthur Jackson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea. Asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson in court. Defendant was denied public defender for this case 22CF33. Defendant applied for a Court appointed attorney. Court reviews income for defendant and that he applied for Court appointed attorney. Court questions defendant on status of contact with Public Defender's Office. Court questions defendant what he would like to do. Defendant states he cannot afford private counsel. State is ready for preliminary hearing. Court keeps preliminary hearing on for this week. Court reviews in 21CF424, no contact with Victim #2, the above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. To match the same condition in 22CF33.

9:59 AM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson not in court.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Calling cases 22CF33 for preliminary hearing, 21CF424 and 21CM296 for STC
State has no information on non appearance, last appeared 4/4/22 CB was ordered across all three files.  Based upon non appearance requests warrants and forf bail on all three files. WI and MN
Court reviews file; notice provided.  Issues warrant and forfs bail/bond.

10:02 Court recalls cases
Defendant Jon Jackson now appears.  Attorney LaLor in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court vacates warrants and forfeitures of bail/bond.
Court questions defendant about intent re: counsel.  Does not qualify for public defender, will need to apply for court appointed attorney.  Court questions on income and indicates that defendant would probably not qualify but does not want to dissuade him from applying. Can adjourn so defendant has time to seek counsel; would have to waive time limits. Or we could go forward today.  
Defendant wishes to have a chance to consult with counsel.  Waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.
State has no objection to adjourning, request to set for STC.
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jon Arthur Jackson
Current: 409 East 5th Street, Duluth, MN 55805 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2022)
Prior: 9428 Grand Av; 104, Duluth, MN 55808
No contact with Victim #1 the above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.

3:01 PM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson appeared by video, in custody. Angela Wilson for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ellen Craker making a special appearance. Court quashes warrant. State requests in 22CF33- $1,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or address. In 21CM295- $500 cash with continued conditions. In 21CF424- $2,500 cash bail with same conditions. Attorney Craker asks for lesser cash bail and has a minimal criminal history. No failures to appear in the past that she knows of. Defendant states he missed Court since he was very scared. Court orders 21CF424 - $2,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1, Victim #2 or Victim #2 address. In 21CM296 - $500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1. In 22CF33 - $1,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 the above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:30 PM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson not in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State- He has warrants in 2 other files. Requests warrant and bail forfeted, cancel prelim. MN WI and UP Michigan
Court- So ordered.
no contact with victim 1, The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.

02:19 PM Defendant Jon Arthur Jackson in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.   States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victim 1, The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.
Defendant argues bail and his F.T.A. as he was sitting in the hallway. Defendant does not qualify. Defendant has very little money he can post. 
Court orders $600 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victim 1   The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.
Defendant waives time limits. Court accepts waive time limits as they are made freely and voluntarily.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
